Name: Marble Sarcophagus with Scenes of Dionysos
Description: The marble sarcophagus is decorated with a relief representing scenes from Greek mythology.The front side depicts Dionysos with his hallmark diadem, or crown, of grape vines, carrying a thyrsus stick, which ends in the shape of an artichoke. Since Dionysos has fallen in love with the beautiful Ariadne at first sight, Cupid as a child is shown flying above him. The girl is sleeping and beside her stands the god of sleep, Hypnos. On the right of the sarcophagus is a scene showing Hercules, heavily drunk, and being led by satyrs away from the wedding party. He is being helped to walk by one of his followers while another carries his heavy club. Preceding them is a woman bearing a torch to light the way. On the left side is an unfinished scene of grape picking and crushing in the Egyptian style.
